### Prerequisites

- [X] Write a descriptive title.
- [X] Make sure you are able to repro it on the [latest released version](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases)
- [X] Search the existing issues.
- [X] Refer to the [FAQ](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/FAQ.md).
- [X] Refer to [Differences between Windows PowerShell 5.1 and PowerShell](https://docs.microsoft.com/powershell/scripting/whats-new/differences-from-windows-powershell).

### Steps to reproduce

```powershell
[string]$a = @'
	$aa = Get-Date -Format 'f'
	$bb = "/root/${aa}.txt"
	touch $bb
'@
$b = $a -split "`n"
$b -join 'zzzz'
#;       touch $bboot/${aa}.txt"'f'

$b.trim() -join 'yyyy' #normal
```
### bug must use tab before 【$aa】,bug code must writed in ps1 script,then run script.
### copy and paste to powershell console  to run normal
### $b.trim() -join 'zzzz' normal

### Expected behavior

```console
$aa = Get-Date -Format 'f'zzzz$bb = "/root/${aa}.txt"zzzztouch $bb
```



### Actual behavior
```console
;       touch $bboot/${aa}.txt"'f'
```



### Error details

_No response_

### Environment data

```
powershell 5.1.19041.1320 on win10
PowerShell 7.3.0-preview.1 on win10
```


### Visuals

_No response_

comments.author: 237dmitry
comments.body:
> run the [aaa-v2.ps1] I uploaded

Works if `-split '\r?\n'`
```
$b = $a -replace '\t' -split '\r?\n'    # without tabs
$b = $a -split '\r?\n'                  # with tabs
```

comments.author: jhoneill
comments.body:
Don't split on \n when the file uses CRLF. If you do that,  the 2nd line prints over the 1st, and line 3 prints over line 2 

It has been recommend for a long time to use 4 spaces instead of a tab character, and in a lot of cases pasting text with a tab in will act as if you pressed the tab key.

comments.author: 237dmitry
comments.body:
>  why does 【tab】 cause the -join problem?

In your example the problem is not with `-join` but with `-split`.

Here is an example where the text is _already split_ into strings, it remains only to join them.: 
```
("	aaaa", "	bbbb", "	cccc") -join "zzzz"
```
